George Stephanopoulos chided, So, can you now concede what Al Gore McCain said last week was correct? That had you stayed in office, there would have been defeat in Iraq and the surge would not have taken place? George Stephanopoulos asserted that individuals such as then-ambassador to Iraq Paul Bremer called for a surge. The host argued, ''It's documented in Bob Woodward 's book.'' Donald Rumsfeld retorted, '' Bob Woodward wasn't there.''

, he fingers the US diplomat in charge of postwar Iraq, Paul Bremer , and criticises the former secretary of state, Colin Powell , and the former national security adviser, Condoleezza Rice . John McCain told ABC television: I respect secretary Donald Rumsfeld . He and I had a very, very strong difference of opinion about the strategy he was employing in Iraq, which I predicted was doomed to failure. Thank God he was relieved of his duties and we put the surge in. Otherwise we would have had a disastrous defeat in Iraq. Middle East would be ''far more perilous than it is today'' if Saddam Hussein had remained in power. He denies he made a mistake in not sending a bigger US force to Iraq in 2003.
